item.title: Topological Obstructions
item.description: Wannier functions of a topologically trivial group of bands are smoothly continuous to an atomic limit, are exponentially localized, and transform under a band representation.

item.title: Quantum Geometry
item.description: Quantum metric g describes distance between wavefunctions T = g + i \Omega Berry curvature is imaginary component.

item.title: Topological Quantum Chemistry
item.description: Question: Topological insulators represent only a few hundred of the 200,000 stoichiometric compounds.

item.title: Topological Insulators
item.description: Predicted by Kane & Mele (2005), and Fu and Kane (2006) as a class of 2D nonmagnetic spin Hall insulators whose Bloch states are topologically twisted.

item.title: Topological Materials
item.description: Until recently, the standard paradigm for understanding phases of matter was through Landauâ€™s symmetry breaking theory and order parameters.

item.title: Space Groups
item.description: A space group is the symmetry group of a repeating pattern in space.

item.title: Point Groups
item.description: In geometry, a point group is a mathematical group of symmetry operations (isometries in a Euclidean space) that have a fixed point in common.

item.title: Wyckoff Positions
item.description: In crystallography, a Wyckoff position is any point in a set of points whose site symmetry groups are all conjugate subgroups of one another.

item.title: Wannier Functions
item.description: Wannier functions are the localized representation of the Bloch energy eigenstates of a periodic crystal.
